intro: Duretia sieboldiana, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lanceolate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Duretia sieboldiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
